name: Chacewater Trail 3 - The Todpool, Poldice Valley, Twelveheads Loop

ai.summary: A 13.9 km circular hike that traverses the Todpool area, Poldice Valley and Twelveheads. This moderate loop combines historic mining landscapes, woodland paths and open moorland with gentle ascents and descents, making it suitable for hikers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-defined tracks and footpaths with sections of moorland and occasional stream crossings. Expect a mix of woodland, open fields and short road stretches. Conditions can be muddy after rain; waterproof boots and weather-appropriate clothing are advised.
ai.safety_notes: Check local conditions before starting the hike. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and bring a waterproof jacket. Carry a map or GPS, a charged phone, and a whistle. Stay on marked paths, be prepared for boggy sections and potential stream crossings after rain, and watch for livestock. Plan for variable weather in Cornwall and daylight hours; tell someone your route and expected return time.
recommended_gear: Ordnance Survey map or GPS device
Whistle and basic first aid kit
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) are generally the best times, with longer daylight and milder weather. Winter hikes can be wet, windy and muddy with shorter days.
